main_question: How is the Prime Minister chosen?
question: How is the Prime Minister chosen?
possible_answers: A. The Governor General chooses the Prime Minister
B. The leader of the party with the most votes nationwide
C. The Prime Minister is elected directly by citizens
D. The leader of the party with the most elected Members of Parliament
answer: D. The leader of the party with the most elected Members of Parliament
explanatory_sentence: The Prime Minister is normally the leader of the political party that wins the most seats in the elected House of Commons and is invited to form the government.
